sentences.english: Angry crowds and RouZi looking for bonzi team conflict to keep order.
sentences.chinese: 激憤的羣衆與肉孜找來維持秩序的棒子隊發生衝突。

sentences.english: Rule-making “shouldn't be done in an environment of social anger.
sentences.chinese: 規則制定“不應該在羣情激憤的環境中進行。”

sentences.english: Tempers flared towards the end of the meeting.
sentences.chinese: 會議快結束時羣情激憤。

sentences.english: She lead the sang rap artist song, sing along with, all public anger.
sentences.chinese: 她帶頭唱起了說唱藝人編的歌，衆人跟唱，羣情激憤。

sentences.english: Perhaps a little radical, but the frustration is understandable.
sentences.chinese: 雖然有點激憤，但還是可以理解其沮喪。

sentences.english: A public outcry in Thailand caused both governments to send troops to the area.
sentences.chinese: 由於泰國民情激憤，兩國政府都派兵駐守該地區。

sentences.english: His indirect way of telling me to leave annoyed me.
sentences.chinese: 他那種不刀切斧砍地讓我分開的方法激憤了我。

definition: to lift restrictions (such as curfew or martial law)
to act in collusion (idiom); in cahoots with/villains will look after one another
internal trouble and outside aggression (idiom); in a mess both domestically and abroad
could happen at any moment/on the verge
to stir up public sentiment by false statements (idiom)/to resort to demagogy
to oppose each other with equal harshness (idiom); tit for tat/measure for measure
